alert.note: Alert for Essex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 09 at 11:16AM EDT until August 10 at 3:31PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Shawsheen River At Andover affecting Essex County. For the Shawsheen River...including Wilmington, Andover...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Shawsheen River at Andover. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Floodwaters encroach on very lowest lying business parking lots off of Route 114 in Lawrence and North Andover that are adjacent to the Shawsheen River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 28.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 28.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 29.2 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 815 AM EDT.
